result.execSummary:
The defendant Lonza S. Caudill was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Lonza S. Caudill is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Lonza S. Caudill was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Lonza S. Caudill was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If revoked, defendant entitled to 17 days credit, subject to verification of the jail.

records.addlTxt: 1:46 PM Defendant Lonza S. Caudill in court.  Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson in court for Lonza S. Caudill.  Attorney Curtis E Johnson in court for State of Wisconsin. State recites joint recommendation:  Ct 1: enhancer dismissed.  Cts  3, 4, 5, & 6: dismissed.  Cts 1 & 2:  W/H 24 mo probation: absolute sobriety; no use or possession of any controlled substances without a valid prescription; random UAs; AODA and follow through recommendations; counseling as recommended by DOC; 10 hrs comm service (ct 1 only).  Court verbally reviews charges/penalties with the defendant. Defendant sworn by the Clerk. Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form - colloquy given.  Defendant freely, willingly, knowledgeably and intelligently enters into the plea agreement and joint recommendation. Court accepts the joint recommendation and sentences the defendant accordingly.
Amended signature bond per DA and Atty Erickson and OK'd by judge (when in court for 22CM40)

1:19 PM Defendant Lonza S. Caudill appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson in court for Lonza S. Caudill.  Attorney Curtis E Johnson in court for State of Wisconsin.  Request for PLEAS in all files.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 2, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

12:29 PM Attorney Curtis E Johnson in court for State of Wisconsin. April Caudill present in person.  Ms. Caudill requests a bond modification to remove no contact order.  This case does not currently have a no contact order of the bond.  Ms. Caudill requests the no contact with her residence be removed.  State objects to removing the no contact with residence.  Court denies request - bond will remain as previously ordered.

2:19 PM Prosecuting attorney Curtis E Johnson appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Lonza S. Caudill appeared in court, in custody, Attorney Zachary P Leigh appeared by video for Lonza S. Caudill.
Status conference scheduled for April 19, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Status conference on February 23, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

02:37 PM Defendant Lonza S. Caudill in court with attorney Zachary Leigh for attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson.  Defendant Lonza S. Caudill in custody.  Curtis E Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Waiver of Preliminary Hearing - colloquy given.  Defendant freely, willingly, knowledgeably and intelligently waives right to preliminary hearing.  Information filed.    Court verbally reviews charges/penalties with the defendant.  Waiver of formal reading of the information.    Defendant stands mute - not guilty plea entered.  Status conference scheduled for February 23, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
Preliminary Hearing on February 18, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

01:23 PM Defendant Lonza S. Caudill in court, via phone, with attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson, via zoom.  Matthew C. Allen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Erickson requests a PH.  Preliminary Hearing scheduled for February 18, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Lonza S. Caudill
Current: Opportunity House, 504 Bennett St. Unit A, Dodgeville, WI 53533 United States  (Effective: 01-25-2022)
Prior: 206 Grove Street, Ridgeway, WI 53582
$1500 cash bond is now amended to $500 cash bond.  Absolute sobriety.  Defendant is not to be at/in any residence of April Caudill.

10:36 AM Defendant Lonza S. Caudill in court, via phone,  with attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson.  Defendant Lonza S. Caudill in custody.  Curtis E. Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  This hearing was set in re request for bond modification.  Atty Erickson advises the defendant has filled out and submitted application to O.H. and Pizza Hut is still holding employment.  Therefore, he  requests modification to $500 cash bond.  State does not object to a modification but would request a no contact with the victim's residence and no violent, abusive or profane conduct.  Court grants request and modifies bond to $500 cash - absolute sobriety; no contact with any residence of the victim.

Bail/bond hearing on January 20, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Status conference on February 8, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

10:16 AM Defendant Lonza S. Caudill in court with attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson, both via zoom.  Defendant Lonza S. Caudill in custody.  Matthew C. Allen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Victim,  A.C., requests cash bond reduction.    Court verbally reviews charges/penalties with the defendant.  Waiver of formal reading of complaint.  Atty Erickson requests bond modification to $500 cash, gives basis.  State does not object to reduction as requested if the defendant is accepted into alternative living/programming.  Defendant advises she has not yet applied for alternate living.  Court will set another hearing this week to allow defendant to contact and apply to that programming.  Time limits for preliminary hearing waived.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for January 20, 2022 at 10:30 am.  Status conference scheduled for February 8, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
